tool.name: Climate Data Operators
tool.description: to manipulate and analyze Climate and NWP model data
tool.command: export HOME=`pwd` && echo "CDO Data Operators is done"

param.name: opt
param.label: Provide cdo options
param.option: -b nbits (Set the number of bits for the output precision)
-k chunktype (NetCDF4 chunk type: auto, grid or lines)
-M (Indicate that the I/O streams have missing values)
-m missval (Set the default missing value . Default is-9e+33)
-R (Convert GRIB1 data from reduced to regular grid)
--seed seed (Seed for a new sequence of pseudo-random numbers(
-t table (Set the parameter table name or file)

param.name: nbits
param.label: Set the number of bits for the output precision (-b nbits)

param.name: format
param.label: Output format e.g. grb1,grb2,nc1,nc2,nc4,nc4c, etc. (-f format)

param.name: grid
param.label: Output format e.g. grb1,grb2,nc1,nc2,nc4,nc4c, etc. (-f format)

tool.help:
**Climate Data Operators (CDO)** =======================================================================================================
This tool is a wrapper to the Climate Data Operators (CDO).
- CDO is a collection of command line Operators to manipulate and analyse Climate and NWP model Data. - There are more than 600 operators available.
- `CDO online documentation <https://code.mpimet.mpg.de/projects/cdo/>`_.
